history.content:
I think the textbook the professors wrote for the class is publicly available here: https://mlstory.org/index.html
I haven't taken the class but, from what I can tell, I think it is more statistics oriented, with a larger focus on causality, inference, and hypothesis testing. So it may be the same models as CS 189 but there will likely be different content and focuses.

I know CS 281A (Statistical Learning Theory) isn't being offered this Spring, but for future semesters I'm wondering if it's worth it or too redundant to take CS 281A after CS 189. The syllabus for 281A is here for anyone else curious. I've heard that 281A can be redundant after CS 189 and should not be taken, but I've also seen somewhere 189 being listed as a prereq for the class. So any advice on the overlap between the courses would be helpful to hear.
history.subject: CS 189 vs CS 281A
